articles.title: Sensex slips 130 pts, Nifty down to 18,733; IndusInd Bank, Infosys, TCS lose
articles.description: IT stocks were the biggest losers in the opening trade, dragging the indices, after JP Morgan reiterated its negative stance on Indian information technology (IT) services.
articles.content: Domestic equities opened lower on Thursday despite Federal Reserve keeping the key policy rate unchanged. BSE benchmark Sensex opened 96.66 points, or 0.15 per cent lower to 63,131.85, while broader … [+979 chars]

articles.author: ENS Economic Bureau
articles.title: Sensex, Nifty touch fresh highs on FII inflows, global cues
articles.description: The BSE Sensex surged 803 points, or 1.26 per cent, to close at an all-time high of 64,718.56. The broader Nifty gained 216.95 points, or 1.14 per cent, to a fresh peak of 19,189.05. During the previous week, Sensex rose by over 1,700 points.
articles.content: Domestic stock markets rose over 1 per cent to end at record highs on Friday, aided by robust inflows from foreign investors, positive global data and progress in monsoon.The BSE Sensex surged 803 po… [+2630 chars]

articles.title: ‘Won’t give inch of land’: Farmers’ body on goods train project in Surat
articles.description: A total of 34 farmers from Ichhapore, 34 from Damka, 35 from Vanswa, and around 10 from Olpad are majorly affected.

articles.author: PTI
articles.title: RBI must repeal notification allowing banks to undertake compromise settlement of wilful defaults: Cong
articles.description: Addressing a press conference at the AICC headquarters here, AICC secretary Vineet Punia and Congress leader Amitabh Dubey said the financial burden on this country from fraud and wilful defaults has been severe.

articles.title: ‘Why is Rahul Gandhi hobnobbing with those funded by George Soros?’: Smriti Irani after FIR against Amit Malviya
articles.description: Union minister Smriti Irani raised questions about Rahul Gandhi’s meetings during his recent US visit and reiterated that the Congress had taken support from people with links to billionaire investor George Soros.

articles.title: George Soros’s son takes over the $25 billion family empire: Who is Alexander Soros?
articles.description: Soros’s younger son, Alexander, has said he plans to continue backing left-leaning US politicians as his father did, in an interview with The Wall Street Journal.

articles.description: "Adani Digital Labs, a wholly owned subsidiary of the company, has signed a share purchase agreement in relation to its proposed acquisition of 100% stake in Stark Enterprises," read a stock exchange notification from Adani Enterprises.

articles.title: Fitch affirms Adani Green RG rating at BBB-, with stable outlook
articles.description: The restricted group's financial profile with debt-service coverage ratio (DSCR) of 1.44 times is stronger than that commensurate with a 'BBB-' rating for the asset portfolio. This reflects considerable rating headroom at the current level, Fitch said.
